column1: A lot about you:

column3: CommercialRealEstate.com.au and Allhomes.com.au.

column1: You will be someone who is enthusiastic and positive with a strong drive to learn new skills and a passion for learning SEO. You will be someone who thrives on working in a fast paced environment and a quick learner of new concepts.

Our success is dependent on our ability capture and convert qualified traffic from search engines like Google and Bing. Google is taking an AI-first approach company-wide
column3: and we need to be on the front foot of these trends to continue our levels of growth and exceed our goals.

column1: Your day to day will look something like this:

Build data collection (from API's and websites)
column2: processing and analysis programs to help grow Domain's organic audience. This includes integrating with data sources such as keyword rankings
column3: website link data
column4: competitive data and website log files.

Capture high level goals and KPI metrics and integrate them with Google Data Studio and Tableau and set a data driven decision making example for the wider business.

You must enjoy working with large data sets and have a passion for spotting trends and insights along with a genuine curiosity about how search engines work with a focus on document retrieval. You will be responsible for deriving meaning from the data
column2: and develop and promote a list of actions as a result of the analysis
column3: plus any learnings on how to improve the collection and upkeep of our datasets.

column1: About the RoleWe are looking for experienced security professionals with considerable expertise in Cyber Incident Response (CIR) and ability to support and mentor our level 1 and 2 threat analyst team in the CIC as an escalation point for incident handling. Our CIC monitoring and response team provides timely and effective support to our clients to help identify the cause of a cyber incident and the impact it has had on the organisation. We then work with the client to identify the most effective method of mitigation and returning the organisation to normal operations. Successful candidates will be required to lead teams of security professionals in high pressure incident response engagements on customer premises.

They will often be looked to by the client to take control of the incident and provide the subject matter expertise to ensure a successful resolution. Successful candidates should also have a broad range of expertise across information security and be able to offer this to the client during any CIR engagement. We’re looking for a dynamic and motivated candidate with strong experience in CIR and ideally a background in SOC analyst roles or penetration testing and red teaming.ResponsibilitiesActing as the escalation point and incident manager for cyber security incidents identified through the CIC level 1 and 2 analyst teams or raised directly by a client.Analysing a specific incident from its detection through to developing a containment strategy and executing subsequent remediation plans.Providing crisis management guidance while onsite with the client directing incident investigation and containment activities. Communicating with the appropriate internal IT and security staff responsible for implementing the appropriate corrective actions.Producing detailed written reports outlining the circumstances around the event and add further input into lessons identified.Mentoring and support for CIC level 1 and 2 team members.

column1: About the RoleWe are looking for experienced security professionals with considerable expertise in Cyber Incident Response (CIR) and ability to support and mentor our level 1 and 2 threat analyst team in the CIC as an escalation point for incident handling. Our CIC monitoring and response team provides timely and effective support to our clients to help identify the cause of a cyber incident and the impact it has had on the organisation. We then work with the client to identify the most effective method of mitigation and returning the organisation to normal operations. Successful candidates will be required to lead teams of security professionals in high pressure incident response engagements on customer premises.

They will often be looked to by the client to take control of the incident and provide the subject matter expertise to ensure a successful resolution. Successful candidates should also have a broad range of expertise across information security and be able to offer this to the client during any CIR engagement. We’re looking for a dynamic and motivated candidate with strong experience in CIR and ideally a background in SOC analyst roles or penetration testing and red teaming.ResponsibilitiesActing as the escalation point and incident manager for cyber security incidents identified through the CIC level 1 and 2 analyst teams or raised directly by a client.Analysing a specific incident from its detection through to developing a containment strategy and executing subsequent remediation plans.Providing crisis management guidance while onsite with the client directing incident investigation and containment activities. Communicating with the appropriate internal IT and security staff responsible for implementing the appropriate corrective actions.Producing detailed written reports outlining the circumstances around the event and add further input into lessons identified.Mentoring and support for CIC level 1 and 2 team members.
